Combine


Combine is an interactive drawing tool for MS-DOS that can be used to create simple or elaborate drawings. Combine contains all the tools needed for creating and editing images. The Combine editing screen is shown below.

Unlike MS Paint and most other simple drawing programs Combine allows the user to define and edit graphic objects which are composed of graphic primitives like lines, circles, curves etc. This is a distinguishing feature of Combine with which a user can produce precise and neat drawings with ease. A user can define a graphic object say the graphic model of a house, a car or any other complex figure and apply the basic transformation operations like translation scaling, and rotation. Since these operations manipulate the coordinates of the graphic primitives and not the image, the result of these operations does not result in loss of clarity in the image. Another special feature of Combine is the fully editable cubic Bezier curves. The Bezier curve tool can be used to specify control points to draw cubic Bezier curve and to edit the control points by positioning them with the mouse to change the shape of the Bezier curve.
